page.title: 08The railway and commuting
page.content: The growth of Ingatestone in modern times reflects its location on the main railway line from London (Liverpool Street Station) to Chelmsford, Ipswich and beyond. The line, originally constructed in the 1840's, is now electrified and although not all trains stop at Ingatestone Station there is a reasonably frequent service to Liverpool Street particularly during rush hours. The service is fairly fast and as such has made the area attractive to commuters. Ingatestone is about 30 miles from London and lies within the 'green belt' - an area around London in which residential and commercial development is severely restricted. A large proportion of the employed population work outside the area.
